name: 4-bromo-n,n-dimethylaniline
Reason: The target compound is 4-bromo-N,N-dimethylaniline with a basic unit aniline, which has a melting point around -6 degrees Celsius. The bromine atom is a heavy substituent which typically increases the melting point due to the larger molecular weight and enhanced intermolecular forces such as dipole-dipole interactions; we can estimate this increase to be +40 degrees Celsius. The N,N-dimethyl groups add steric hindrance and electron-donating effects which also can increase the melting point. However, branching typically lowers melting point due to poorer packing. Therefore, we can estimate the increase due to each N,N-dimethyl group to be about +10 degrees Celsius. Thus, summing up all these effects, we would estimate the melting point of the target compound as -6 (aniline base) + 40 (Br) + 20 (two N,N-dimethyl groups) = 54 degrees Celsius.
